text: The Sheikdom of Upper Asir was an Arab state which was established in August 1916, after it broke away from the Idrisid Emirate of Asir. It was led by Al- Hasan Bin Ayad. It became a protectorate of the Kingdom of Hejaz in 1920. The region was occupied and annexed by the Sultanate of Nejd in 1923, which would later become modern-day Saudi Arabia. == References == Category:Former Arab states Category:Former monarchies of Asia Category:Ottoman Arabia Category:Former emirates Category:Successor states
title: Sheikdom of Upper Asir
